results.title: Lulu on the bridge
results.creator_credit: Paul Auster, Amy Kaufman, Greg Johnson, Peter Newman and Redeemable Features
results.brief_description: Writer Paul Auster made his solo directorial debut with this romantic drama that combines myth and realism in a form of storytelling that is both simple and complex. Izzy Maurer is a jazz saxophonist whose life is permanently changed when he is hit by a stray bullet. After his recovery, Izzy can no longer play and falls into a depression. He stumbles across the body of a stranger and ends up with the dead man’s briefcase. Inside, he discovers a mysterious stone which leads him to Celia Burns, an aspiring actress and listener of his music. Together, they discover the power of the stone and the threat of those who want it, as the story takes a dark and surprising turn into the Pandora’s Box of Izzy’s soul. Cast includes Harvey Keitel, Mira Sorvino, Willem Dafoe, Gina Gershon and Vanessa Redgrave.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Auster, Amy Kaufman, Greg Johnson, Peter Newman and Redeemable Features

results.title: Billy's Hollywood screen kiss
results.creator_credit: Tommy O'Haver, David Moseley and Revolutionary Eye
results.brief_description: Tommy O’Haver’s upbeat romantic comedy is an affectionate tribute to gay men’s affiliation and love affair with the movies and the larger than life screen passions which subsequently inform and delude romantic expectations. Aspiring photographer Billy Coller (Sean. P Hayes) is down on his luck financially and romantically. His unfortunate habit of falling for straight guys lands heterosexual model Gabriel (Brad Rowe) into his path. When Billy enlists his new found lust object into posing for a series of queer themed photos aping classic screen kisses, sexual confusion ensues. Cast includes Paul Bartel, Holly Woodlawn, Richard Ganoung and Meredith Scott Lynn.

results.title: McLibel: two worlds collide
results.brief_description: In 1990, McDonalds served a defamation writ against David Morris and Helen Steel over their many criticisms of the multinational contained in a community leaflet. After 7 years and 20,000 pages of testimony, McLibel tells the story of what became the longest running trial in England’s history. Without access to legal aid Morris and Steel represented themselves in a case that struck at the heart of free speech and raised many vexing issues. They included the right of a multinational to suppress criticism simply by suing for libel; corporate accountability in advertising; and the fairness of a legal system that allows such cases of libel by multinationals whilst denying legal representation to defendants. The documentary uses interviews with witnesses and reconstructions of key moments in court (directed by Ken Loach) to examine the main issues in the trial (nutrition, advertising, employment, cruelty to animals, environment). McLibel is about multinational corporations and the power they wield over our every lives. Reference: McLibel: two worlds collide. Online. http://www.spanner.org/mclibel/index.htm Accessed: 15/3/2000. See also: ‘Hamburger’ (306660).

results.title: Love streams
results.creator_credit: John Cassavetes, Menahem Golan, Yoram Globus and Cannon Group
results.brief_description: In Cassavetes’ films the meaning behind love, relationships and identity cannot be easily apprehended because characters are always placed in the thick of things. “Love Streams” is about a brother and sister with different approaches to love, who come together to ease each other’s trouble. Robert Harmon doesn’t know how to establish lines of communication with his son, girlfriend and ex-wife. On the other hand, his sister, Sarah Lawson, repels her daughter and husband with her obsessive love. In an early scene Sarah states to the court that “love is a continuous stream”. The saying informs the rest of the director’s work, where the characters’ personal dilemmas perpetuate their own life.

results.title: Opening night
results.creator_credit: John Cassavetes, Al Ruban and Faces Distribution Corporation
results.brief_description: Myrtle Gordon is a successful actress who finds the part she has taken in a new play, about a “defeated, older woman”, humiliating. When a young fan is killed outside the theatre one night, Myrtle uses the experience of the girl and the accident to revisit her youth. While she searches for a vantage-point to perform the part, the film shows how the play and the world behind the play interact and threaten to draw her into collapse.

results.title: A Woman under the influence
results.creator_credit: John Cassavetes, Sam Shaw and Faces International Films Inc
results.brief_description: The title of this film refers to a wife and mother, Mabel Longhetti, who moves completely under the influence of her family and other people. She tries so hard to perform and conform, according to what she perceives they want, but she just comes across as “crazy” and the family are embarrassed. In the confusion, the film makes Mabel an expressive centre, focusing on the commotion she causes and the forms of agitation that extend across her face and body.

results.title: The Killing of a Chinese bookie
results.creator_credit: John Cassavetes, Al Ruban and Faces Distribution Corporation
results.brief_description: The Killing of a Chinese Bookie presents a portrait of a man who is so self-sufficient that he cannot become personally involved with anyone. Cosmo Vitelli, played by Ben Gazzara, is a nightclub owner who believes in conducting his personal and business affairs with plenty of flair and professionalism. When the mob threatens him he works desperately to save his face and the club.

results.title: Faces
results.creator_credit: John Cassavetes, Maurice McEndree and Walter Reade Organization
results.brief_description: Faces concentrates on two scenarios, one where middle-aged businessmen cheat on their wives and the other where the wives bring home a younger man from a nightclub. Both wives and husbands take turns in testing the novelty of the situations, initially improvising to bridge the awkwardness but then risking more and more. While the night out feels liberating, it ends up tearing painfully at their conservative personas.

results.title: Skeletons aren't scary
results.creator_credit: John Dick, Bosisto Productions and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Using muppets and animated sequences, this film deals with the death of a children’s cat and the feelings and emotions that are associated with death and dying.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Dick, Bosisto Productions and South Australian Film Corporation

results.title: Mean streets
results.creator_credit: Martin Scorsese, Jonathan Taplin and Taplin-Perry-Scorsese Productions
results.brief_description: Scorsese drew on his own childhood and adolescence (Harvey Keitel is his alter ego) in depicting the macho world of small time crime in New York’s Little Italy. He achieves a certain psychological distance from the obsessions of growing up Catholic in a society structured by contradictions and rituals. The loose, jagged structure contains an extraordinary blend of the operatic (the film has been described as a kind of rock opera) and the naturalistic (there was a good deal of improvisation by the actors). The effect of the lighting in bars and streets takes the film to the edge of expressionism; the hand held, rapidly tracking camera amplifies the sense of emotional and physical violence. Much of the film was actually shot in Los Angeles. Cast also includes David Proval, Amy Robinson and Richard Romanus.
